document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Su, Yirui & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VII: the subpollinosa species group from China, with morphological and molecular evidence

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VII: the subpollinosa species group from China, with morphological and molecular evidence

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Leucophenga nigroscutellata
Duda, 1924a : 186
; 1924b: 237;
Lin & Wheeler, 1972 : 249
;
Okada, 1987 : 679
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species is mostly similar to
L . fuscipedes
sp. nov.
in having the wing fuscous along R1 and costa ( Fig. 2 D, L), the shape of paramere ( Figs. 13 , 20 C), and the aedeagus ventrolaterally with a thin process bearing a sensillum at tip ( Figs. 13 , 20 D), but can be distinguished from the latter by the color patterns of abdominal tergites in both male ( Fig. 7 E, F) and female ( Fig. 8 A), and the aedeagus rounded apically ( Fig. 13 D); see below that species.

However, the specimens show distinctly differences from the latest and most relevant description of
L . nigroscutellata
from Malaysia and Indonesia ( Okada 1987 ) in the paramere ( Fig. 13 C) and aedeagus ( Fig. 13 D) lacking pubescence, and the structure of aedeagus ( Fig. 13 D), while no conspicuous difference could be found in having the thorax mostly dark colored ( Fig. 3 G), and the color patterns of abdominal tergites in both male ( Fig. 7 E, F; Fig. 1 C in Okada 1987 ) and female ( Fig. 8 A; Fig. 1 D in Okada 1987 ); moreover, parts of the specimens were collected near the type locality. Therefore, all of the specimens were identified as
L . nigroscutellata
to avoid further confusion.

Description. Ocellar triangle dark brown, with ca. 0–2 seta(e) above ocellar setae. Frons brownish yellow, with an indistinct, brownish, longitudinal stripe medially. Pedicel brownish yellow; first flagellomere yellow. Clypeus brown. Palpus brownish yellow to brownish. Mesonotum brownish yellow to brownish, mostly with three broad, brown, longitudinal stripes medially and laterally in male ( Fig. 3 G), brownish yellow, brownish before scutellum in female. Postpronotal lobe yellow ( Fig. 3 H). Acrostichal setulae in ca. 8–12 irregular rows ( Fig. 3 G). Scutellum dark brown, brownish yellow at tip ( Fig. 3 G). Pleura, katepisternum and meron mostly brown above ( Fig. 3 H). Wing ( Fig. 2 D): Costal vein between R2+3 and R4+5 distally with ca. 4–7 peg-like spinules on ventral surface. Midleg obviously dark brown on knees. Abdominal tergites brown to black, with a yellow patch medially between 2nd to 3rd tergites in male ( Fig. 7 E), 2nd tergite with a yellow patch medially or posteromedially in female ( Figs. 7 E, 8A), 5th tergite with a pair of yellow patches anteromedially in some female ( Fig. 8 A). Male terminalia: Epandrium with ca. 3 setae near posterior margin per side ( Fig. 13 A). Surstylus rounded apically ( Fig. 13 A). Hypandrium with 1 sensillum ( Fig. 13 B). Paramere with ca. 1 sensillum submediodorsally and ca. 7 sensilla distally ( Fig. 13 C).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 13.
Leucophenga nigroscutellata Duda, 1924
, male terminalia in lateral view. A. Epandrium, surstylus and cercus; B. Hypandrium, paramere, gonopods and aedeagus; C. Paramere; D. Aedeagus and laterally process (lp). Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

Distribution. China ( Taiwan , Yunnan ), Nepal ,
Sri Lanka
, Borneo, Malaysia (Cameron Highlands), Indonesia ( Java ).
